comments:
Array index out of bond exception can be seen on the log when removing a 
variable from datapool. Console is throwing Unhandled exception.

Note: Also I noticed, even if variable exist still the remove variable contect 
menu is disabled.

Steps to reproduce:
   Use an existing datapool (or create a datapool and a equivalent class)
   Add a variable.
   Click on the variable column , you can see the remove variable button is 
   disabled.
   Click again and add a variable.
   It is little tricky, if you change the column focus this will not happen.   
You may need to do multiple times to see the actual trick. Attached log will 
help to fix the defect.

Now that we have a "3.3" Version in bugzilla, updating bugzillas targeted to 3.3
or a 3.3 iteration so that their Version matches their Target. "future",
"unspecified", "4.0", and "4.1" Versions will not be updated.

Lili, please note like a couple other defects, the problem was found during
testing of 3.0.2.  In 3.3 or 4.0, it might not be exactly the same and might
need a little re-evaluation.  Thanks.
Fixed the error that when trimmed string is empty should just return it.

Sorry that previous comments are incorrectly put in this defect. 
Fix for this defect includes:
1. Fixed the array index exception when the last variable of a datapool is removed.
2. Fixed the menu item disabled problem when the first variable is removed.
3. Fixed the problem that when all variables are removed, without save, cannot
add the 2nd new variable.
